title_sort: joseph c. baldwin to walt whitman, 11 august 1877
title: Joseph C. Baldwin to Walt Whitman, 11 August 1877
text: Elliottstown Effingham Co: Ills:â€”August 11th /77Dear WaltThinking you would like to Here[Hear] from me I would write you a few lines in as much as Im[I'm] well and Hope this will find you the sameBusiness is very dull Here now and crops is ruined for the want of rain. all of my worment[torment] of of mind and toil of body is of no avil[avail] Im[I'm] feafuly[fearfully] in want now and when my crops is geathered[gathered] it wont[won't] be much better as I see O I musent[mustn't] say Im[I'm] in want Because I Have got plenty to eat and some close[clothes]But not much money now I dont[don't] nead[need] as muchBut the fuather[future] looks dark But may come out Better than I amagn[imagine]I will Buy some Hogs on a credit and feed my unsailable[unsellable] corn to them and may come out all right in due time I received those papers many thanks)yours trulyJos. C. Baldwinwrite soon Joseph C. Baldwin to Walt Whitman, 11 August 1877
